title: Create a new React component
description: Begin by creating a new component in your React application. Let's name it ListWithAnimation

title: Import the necessary dependencies
description: Import React, the Tailwind CSS styles, the Framer Motion library, and any other required dependencies.

title: Define the ListWithAnimation component
description: Declare the functional component and export it for use in other parts of your application. Provide the structure and logic for rendering the list with animation.

title: Pass the listData as a prop
description: The component expects a prop called listData which should be an array of strings. This array contains the data that will be displayed as the list items.

title: Implement the list animation
description: Use the Framer Motion library to animate the list items. Wrap each list item with the motion.li component and provide animation properties such as initial, animate, and transition.

title: Apply Tailwind CSS classes
description: Utilize Tailwind CSS classes to style the list container, list items, and any other desired elements within the component.

title: Render the ListWithAnimation component
description: In your desired parent component, import the ListWithAnimation component and pass the listData prop with the array of strings you want to display.

title: Style the component further
description: Customize the appearance of the list and add additional CSS or Tailwind classes to achieve the desired visual effect.
